news_header: Merger talks between Honda and Nissan have collapsed due to disagreements over the structure of the partnership. The proposed merger aimed to create a $60 billion auto group to compete against rivals, particularly in China.
news_text: Analysts noted that the failure was not surprising, given the history of unsuccessful automotive mergers. Both companies will continue their partnership in electric vehicles, but Nissan faces ongoing challenges, including leadership issues and competition from Chinese manufacturers. Potential investor Foxconn has expressed interest in collaborating with Nissan and Renault.
